lines_and_colors: Some keep the Sabbath going to church,
I keep it staying at home,
With a bobolink for a chorister,
And an orchard for a dome.
Some keep the Sabbath in surplice,
And instead of tolling the bell for church,
And the sermon is never long;
So instead of going to heaven at last,
document.title: Some keep the Sabbath going to church
document.publication: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Variorum Edition, Franklin, 1998
